intro: Hoarea violiflora, commonly known as the violet-flowered horehound, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a minty fragrance. Hoarea violiflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
